text: is a former Japanese football player. He played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Izumi was born in Hiroshima Prefecture on April 8, 1944. After graduating from Meiji University, he joined Japanese Regional Leagues club Toyota Motors in 1967. The club was promoted to Japan Soccer League Division 1 in 1972 and Division 2 in 1973. He retired in 1976. On March 25, 1965, when Izumi was a Meiji University student, he debuted for the Japan national team against Singapore and Japan won the match.Japan National Football Team Database However, after graduating from university in 1967, he was not selected Japan because he joined a club which playing in Japanese Regional Leagues. After retirement, Izumi became a manager for Toyota Motors. He managed 1 season in 1987â€“88, but the club finished at the bottom place and was relegated Division 2. ==Statistics== Japan National Football Team Database |- |1965||1||0 |- !Total||1||0 |} ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1944 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Hiroshima Prefecture Category:Japan international footballers Category:Japan Soccer League players Category:Nagoya Grampus players
title: Masanobu Izumi
